work_with_me_opening:
Open research questions

1) Epidemiological dynamics modeling, forecasting, and understanding. In particular, in integration with other disciplines such as economy, governance, business management, biology, clinical, etc.
2) Socio-economic tasks - solving analytically, numerically, or using simulation a wide range of social, government, and economic tasks.
3) Developing data-driven personalized clinical treatment protocols. In particular, I prefer cancer and autoimmune diseases (such as diabetes).
4) I am a big fan of anything cool that you can simulate and use AI for decision-making, so you can be creative.

Purpose

It is important to make an informed decision when choosing a research mentor. This document will help you to understand how I view my role as a mentor as well as the expectations that I have for members of our team. This document is under constant review and revision, as it should be since it is a constant work in progress. Moreover, these guidelines are a bit generic as each person’s mentorship and training needs are unique.

Your mentorship network

It is important to recognize that I am not an expert in all areas in which you wish to receive mentorship. However, I do consider it my responsibility to ensure that when I cannot meet your needs in a specific area we work together to connect you with a mentor that can. I encourage you to seek out their expertise and advice. You should not view me as the person central to your mentoring network since you are the central person in your mentoring network. Cultivating a thriving mentoring network is an important part of your research training and I will work to help you get started and identify your specific needs and how those needs can be met.

My mentorship commitment to you when you join the team

1) At the bare minimum, we will have a weekly 1:1 meeting. I will do my best to never cancel this meeting if not absolutely necessary. If that happens, the meeting will be rescheduled for as soon as possible. You can cancel this meeting whenever you like. It is your time.

2) Our 1:1 agenda by default will include discussions about your wellness, readiness, obstacles, recognition, and feedback from me. However, you should be added to the meeting invite for any agenda you would like to have. This is important so we remember important topics, but you are free to use the time for whatever is on your mind.

3) When I schedule a meeting with you, I will always tell you what the meeting will be about when it is scheduled.

4) News or announcements that significantly impact you or your work will always come from me directly in a 1:1 meeting. I will hold dear your privacy.

5) You will always get feedback from me when it is fresh. You will never get feedback from me when we discuss your overall performance that will be a surprise. We will always try to talk about small issues that come up so they do not turn into big issues.

6) I trust you to manage your own time. You don’t need to clear with me in advance your time. You do not need to ask my permission to attend important appointments during business hours.

7) Your work gets done your way. My focus is on outcomes, not output. Once we are clear on where we need to go, how you get there is up to you, with support from me and your committee as required.

8) A team is strongest when it is working together, looking after each other, and taking care of one another. Please look to your left and to your right for opportunities to help other members of our team. Please ask for help when you need it. Nobody works alone.

9) I trust you to skip over me and talk to other colleagues (like your committee members/mentors) about anything you feel is relevant. You do not need to clear it with me in advance.

10) I will attribute credit appropriately to you. I will never exaggerate my own role or minimize your contribution. I will be especially certain to nail down attribution when people want to hear about our accomplishments.

Publishing

In general, if a paper is written regarding a part of your research project and you conducted the research and prepared the manuscript you will be named as the first author. This policy is the same for all trainees. If other members of the team were involved in the work, they will also be listed as authors based on their contributions or alphabetically if their contributions were equal. No manuscripts will be submitted to any journal, conference etc. without the prior review and consent of all co-authors (this includes student co-authors).

Conflict resolution

It is my expectation that if you are having a problem with someone else on the team that you will begin by approaching that person to discuss the problem openly. If the problem is not resolved to your satisfaction, then you are free to speak to me about the problem and I can help to mediate a remedy. If your problem is with me, please schedule an appointment so that we can discuss your concerns and try to remedy the problem. If you keep the problem to yourself there is no way for me to know that you are unhappy with the way things are going and, in my experience, most problems are easily remedied with an open discussion.


Team members

The best way to know if you want to work with me, is to ask individuals that already done this decision. You can (and should) approach them directly so they can tell you the truth with all the pros and cons. I suggest mixing current and alumni to get the bigger picture. This is a partial list of these are OK with been addressed about this manner.

Current

1) Ariel Alexi, 2022-2023 MS. & 2023-current Ph.D., ariel.147@gmail.com .
2) Liel Mushiev, 2023-current MS., lielli.hit@gmail.com .

Alumni

1) Liron Simon, 2021-2023 MS., lirons.gb@gmail.com .


I would like to thank Dr. Amy Greer for the idea for this page. Most of its content is an adaptation of her own text.

projects.name: More research projects will be update soon
projects.description: I need to upload several projects but do not have time at the moment, so promise to do so until the end of the semester :)

projects.name: How Colaborations Influance Writting Style
projects.description: In this research, we anaylzed using a time-dependent graph model and several deep learning based natural language processing models the dynamics of writting style in academic texts, focusing on papers from the exact science domain from the DBLP dataset.

projects.name: Predicting the locaiton of metastates of lung cancer using the location of the original location
projects.description: We develop a novel bio-clinical model with compuer vision component to predict the location of lung cancer metastates.

projects.name: The Economical-Epidemiological Management Of The Coffee Trees Rust Pandemic
projects.description: In this research, we provide the most realistic and accurate coffee rust pandemic model and simulation that takes into consideration the economic dynamics. We used our model on historical data from Colombia.

projects.name: Trust and Work Engagement in Law Enforcement: The case of Brazil
projects.description: I promise to add later

projects.name: Alexi's Master (1) - A Security Games Inspired Approach for Distributed Controlling Of Pandemic Spread
projects.description: In this research, we propose a novel Pandemic Intervention Policy (PIP) that relies on the strategic deployment of Inspection Units (IUs). These IUs are allocated in the environment, represented as a graph, and sample individuals who pass through the same node. If a sampled individual is identified as infected, she is extracted from the environment until she recovers (or dies).

projects.name: Alexi's Master (2) - The Trade-off Between Energy Consumption and Airborne Pandemic Control Using Air-Ventilation Systems
projects.description: We measured the energetic consumption and air ventilation capabilities of central air-ventilation fresh air system, anti-bacterial indoor device, and open window in inpatient rooms, classrooms, and conference rooms. This way, we will find the Parto-optimal trade-off between energy consumption and pandemic spread.

projects.name: Alexi's Master (3) - A Security Games For Pandemic Spread
projects.description: We extend the previous work - not sure how at this point...

projects.name: Alexi's Master (4) - Multi-Species Prey-Predator Dynamics During a Multi-Strain Pandemic
projects.description: We investigate the ecosystem's sensitivity during a multi-strain pandemic for several properties in syntactic cases. In addition, we used two real-world configurations to evaluate the influence of the inner-species and cross-species infection on the long-term ecosystem's stability, showing that cross-infection.

projects.name: Academic Co-authorship is a Risky Game
projects.description: Publication authorship is one of the main recognitions researchers obtain for their research. It is therefore paramount to have a robust and acceptable system in place that ensures fairness and due process for disputes. The current system largely relies on the integrity of researchers but often fails when disputes arise. The use of an unbiased, data-driven model could overcome this limitation. In this study, we developed the first game-theory-inspired model to explore the dynamics of co-authorship disputes. The results are alarming and suggest that the current academic practices are not fit for purpose. Worryingly, our model shows that the number of potential disputes increases as the number of authors participating in the research increases, which is the global trend.

projects.name: OMEGA
projects.description: We develop an algorithm to simulation pathogenic DNA sequences from healthy sequences.

projects.name: Bounding Pandemic Spread By Heat Spread
projects.description: We provide a theoretical upper boundery for the pandemic spread (SIR model) in the form of heat spread on an infection graph.

projects.name: Generic Approach For Mathematical Model of Multi-Strain Pandemics
projects.description: We propose a multi-strain epidimological model based on the SIR model and show several analytical properties of the model.

projects.name: Mathematical Model for the BCG-based Treatment Of Type 1 Diabetes
projects.description: We propose a BCG immunotherapy for the T1D and show numerical results for the mouse model.

projects.name: Assessing The Scientific Neglect Of Animal Species At Risk Of Extinction
projects.description: We provide a wide range litreture review of animal species and compute the neglection of the academic community to several of them.

projects.name: Advanced Muti-Mutation with Intervention Policies Pandemic Model
projects.description: We propose a multi-strain with several clinical and genotype dynamics epidimological model and numerically show its ability to predict the course of a pandemic in Israel.

projects.name: An Enhanced Pandemic Spread with Mutations SIVRI Model
projects.description: We extend the multi-strain model from the previous work, including more clinical processes, showing predictions for several countries.

projects.name: Evaluating Taxation Policies Outcomes In a Close and Supply-Demand Based Economy with Heterogeneous Population using Genetic Algorithms
projects.description: We developed a mathematical model and computer simulation for close economy supply-demand model to evaluate taxation policies.

projects.name: Socioeconomic Model for Work Engagement in the Public Sector
projects.description: Not avalible yet.

projects.name: A review of the behavioural changes and physiological adjustments of elasmobranchs and teleost's to ocean acidification with a focus on sharks
projects.description: A systematic overview of the litreture regarding marine life with focus on sharks.

projects.name: Comparison Of Pandemic Intervention Policies In Different Building Types Using Spatio-Temporal Model
projects.description: We are studing the pandemic spread indoor for several types of buildings based on extended SIR model

projects.name: Financing and Managing Epidemiological-Economic Crisis: The Reserve Model
projects.description: An economic taxation policy for handling future crisises with mathematical model and in silico experiments.

projects.name: A New Definition For Feature Selection Stability Analysis
projects.description: We propose a new definition for FS stability analysis and show how it outperform the classical metrics.

projects.name: Optimal Filter And Embedding Feature Selection Ensemble For Explainable Machine Learning Models
projects.description: We propose a meta-meta search algorithm for automatic machine learning, focusing on Filter and Embedded feature selection.

projects.name: The Influence Of Lockdown Due To Pandemic On The Population’s Mental Health
projects.description: We analyze historical data about the COVID-19 pandemic in Israel with epidimological, social, and mental health data.

projects.name: Stable Dataset Summarizing
projects.description: We propose a new algorithm to summarize datasets for faster analysis pipelines.

projects.name: High Resolution Mathematical Model for Airborne Pandemic Spread Indoors
projects.description: We investigate the influance of air circulation inside a room on the pandemic spread.

projects.name: A Better Prediction of the Non-Observed Economy in Israel
projects.description: A new (more stable) mathematical model for estimating the non-observable economy. An empirical analysis for Israel is conducted.

projects.name: Estimation of Non-Observed Economy Using Observed Economy and Partial Non-Observed Economy with Deep Learning
Estimating the damages of an unreported oil tanker spill using integrated physical-economic modeling: the Israel February 2021 marine and coastal petroleum contamination
An Algorithm to Optimize Explainability using Feature Ensembles
projects.description: A feature selection algorithms that uses iterative ensemble intersections given preformance and explainability metrics to obtain an optimal feature set.

projects.name: The Connection Between Associative Distance and Rumination in Hebrew Speaking Individuals
projects.description: Developing a machine learning model for words' associative distance (Hebrew). Based on this model, propusing new rumination test for clinical professionals.

projects.name: Predicting Acute Kidney Injury Following Open Partial Nephrectomy Treatment Using SAT-Pruned Explainable Machine Learning Model
projects.description: Developing an eXplanable AI to predict acute kidney injury (AKI) complications due to Partial Nephrectomy (PN) treatment.

projects.name: Sphera – A template for personal academic websites
projects.description: Sphera is a free open-source website template that will vastly improve the communication between lecturers and students. It will provide lecturers and professors with the tools to easily create a professional personal website that contains their research, courses and personal projects. We will study the user behaivor in personal acadmic websites and how to improve it using machine learning reccomendation system.

projects.name: Decision Tree Post-Pruning Without Loss Of Accuracy using the SAT-PP algorithm with An Empirical Evaluation on Clinical Data
projects.description: We propose a new Boolean satisfiability (SAT) based PP algorithm, SAT-PP algorithm, which reduces the tree size while preserving the accuracy of the unpruned tree, since in medical-related tasks, decreasing the model's performance is something we emphatically try to avoid where better training is not an option.

projects.name: Mathematical model for the early stage Type 1 Diabetes BCG-based Prevention Treatment
projects.description: Developing from scratch a new bio-clinical model for type 1 disbetes treatment using BCG in early stages of the diseases.

projects.name: A More Numerically Accurate Algorithm For Matrix Exponent
projects.description: we propose a novel highly accurate numerical algorithm for the matrix exponent (ME). The algorithm is based on approximating Putzler's algorithm by analytically solving the ODE based coefficients and approximating them.

projects.name: Improved Geometric Configuration for the Bladder Cancer BCG-based Immunotherapy Treatment Model
projects.description: We present an extension to the model proposed by Lazebnik et al. (2020) by improving the approximation of the bladder’s geometry from sphere-ring to ellipsoid-ring.

projects.name: Predicting the locaiton of metastates of lung cancer using the location of the primary tumor
projects.description: We develop a computer simulation in order to predict the locations of metastates in lung cancer.

projects.name: Simulating Street Level Birucrats Decision Making
projects.description: Not avalible yet.

projects.name: Machine translation from Russian to English for Academic Papers
projects.description: A dedicated ML model for machine translation from Russian to English for Academic papers.

projects.name: Computer Aided Functional Style Identification and Usage In Modern-Russian Texts
projects.description: A deep learning model for functional style classification in Russian and a software to help humans to perform functional style corrections in a text

projects.name: Novel Method to Analytically Obtain the Asymptotic Stable Equilibria States of Extended SIR-type Epidemiological Models
projects.description: We present a new analytical method to find the asymptotic stable equilibria states based on the Markov chain technique. We reveal this method on the SIR-type epidemiological model that we developed for viral diseases with long-term immunity memory pandemic.

projects.name: A Distinction of Three Online Learning Pedagogic Paradigms
projects.description: We studied three online pedagogic paradigm (Synchronous, Asynchronous, and Asynchronous with an audience) and their influence on the students learning process and achievements during an academic mathematics course that was conducted online.

projects.name: Pandemic Management by a Spatio-temporal Mathematical Model
projects.description: A spatio-temporal mathematical model based on the SIR model and graph-based spatial dynamics solved using distrebuted system methods, allowing to investigate several non-pharmaceutical intervention (NPI) policies to control the epidemic.

projects.name: Spatio-Temporal Influence of Non-Pharmaceutical Interventions Policies on Pandemic Dynamics and the Economy: The Case of COVID-19
projects.description: A spatio-temporal mathematical model with economic dynamics. We investigate the influance and find optimal non-pharmaceutical intervention (NPI) policies on the pandemic and the economy.

projects.name: PDE Based Geometry Model for BCG Immunotherapy of Bladder Cancer
projects.description: We present a model describing a BCG immunotherapy dynamic taking into consideration an approximation of the bladder’s geometry using PDE.

projects.name: Optimal Border Closure Policy and Tourism Flows During Epidemiological-Economic Crises: An Artificial Intelligence Approach.
projects.description: A epidemiological-economic simulation, allowing to investigate the influance of non-pharmaceutical intervention policies on international tourism during a pandemic.

projects.name: Pharmaceutical and Non-pharmaceutical Intervention Policies of a Multi-Sectoral Economic-Epidemiological Model
projects.description: A epidemiological-economic simulation, allowing to investigate the influance of non-pharmaceutical intervention policies on multi-sectoral economy in a local and international scale.

projects.name: Rivendell v.3 with explicit collaborative learning
projects.description: Improvments to the Rivendell search engine. Including collaborative learning. The development done on C# based dot net core 2

projects.name: Property-Value tagging tool as website
projects.description: Prodcution-ready (C# on dot net core 2) search engine.

projects.name: Rivendell v.2 with online learning search engine
projects.description: Prodcution-ready (C# on dot net core 2 with Angular 8) SaaS providing for taggers an easy to use Property-Value tagging GUI.
